longDescription: Dermal fillers are injectable gel-based treatments that restore lost volume, smooth wrinkles, and enhance facial contours. Using hyaluronic acid—a substance naturally found in your skin—these FDA-approved treatments deliver immediate, natural-looking results that can last from 6 to 18 months depending on the product and area treated.

safety.title: Safety First, Always

overview.content:
Dermal fillers are soft, gel-like substances injected beneath the skin to restore lost volume, enhance facial contours, and smooth away wrinkles. Most modern fillers use hyaluronic acid (HA)—a naturally occurring substance in your body that retains moisture and provides volume.

At Dr. SNA Clinic, we exclusively use premium, FDA-approved brands like Juvederm and Restylane, known for their safety profile and natural results. Our expert injectors use advanced techniques to create subtle enhancements that honor your unique facial architecture.
overview.title: What Are Dermal Fillers?

title: Dermal Fillers

seo.h1: Premium Dermal Fillers in London | Expert Natural Results
seo.metaDescription: Expert dermal filler treatments in London. Restore volume, enhance lips, smooth wrinkles. Natural results from £295. Premium Juvederm & Restylane.

schema.howPerformed: After applying numbing cream, smooth hyaluronic acid gel is carefully injected beneath your skin using ultra-fine needles or a flexible cannula (like a tiny tube). We sculpt and shape as we go, checking symmetry from every angle. The gel instantly fills lines and restores lost volume, creating natural-looking fullness
schema.preparation: Arrive with clean, makeup-free skin. Avoid blood-thinning supplements and alcohol for one week before to reduce bruising risk. Stay well-hydrated. Bring inspiration photos showing results you love. We'll design your perfect look together
schema.followup: Apply ice packs for the first 24 hours to minimize swelling. Sleep elevated for two nights. Avoid intense exercise, alcohol, and extreme heat for 48 hours. Don't massage treated areas unless we advise it. Results improve as swelling fades over 2 weeks
schema.outcome: Immediately fuller, more youthful appearance. Lips gain volume and definition. Cheeks lift and contour beautifully. Lines soften and smooth. The gel attracts water for plump, hydrated skin. Results last 6-18 months depending on area and product used. Your face moves naturally—just looks refreshed and balanced
schema.medicationRequired: Topical numbing cream, sometimes local anesthetic injection for comfort
schema.treatmentFrequency: Single treatment, then optional top-ups every 9-18 months as filler gradually dissolves. Many patients maintain results with yearly visits
schema.adverseOutcome: Temporary swelling and possible bruising for 3-7 days (especially lips). Mild tenderness and redness. Tiny bumps that smooth out within days. Very rarely, lumps that need massage or dissolution

seriousAdverseOutcome.name: Vascular occlusion (blocked blood vessel)
seriousAdverseOutcome.probability: Extremely rare (less than 0.01%) when performed by experienced medical professionals with proper technique and emergency protocols

contraindication: Active skin infection or cold sore outbreak
Severe allergies to hyaluronic acid (extremely rare)
clinicalFindings: Desire to enhance specific features (lips, cheeks, etc.)

seo.metaTitle: Dermal Fillers London | Facial Fillers | Dr. SNA Clinic

testimonials.text: I was terrified of looking overdone, but Dr. Abbas created the most perfect, natural lips! He added just enough volume to balance my features. I get compliments constantly, and people can't tell I've had fillers—they just say I look amazing.
testimonials.name: Sophie R.
Olivia M.
testimonials.text: After losing weight, my face looked gaunt and tired. Dr. Abbas restored volume in my cheeks and smoothed my smile lines. The results are incredible—I look like I did 10 years ago! Everyone asks what my secret is.

testimonials.name: Charlotte B.
testimonials.text: I wanted a more defined jawline and Dr. Abbas delivered beyond my expectations. The treatment was surprisingly comfortable, and the results are stunning. My profile is so much more sculpted and elegant now.

faq.question: Do dermal fillers hurt?
faq.answer: Most patients experience mild discomfort rather than pain. We apply numbing cream before treatment, and many modern fillers contain lidocaine (local anesthetic) for comfort. Most describe the sensation as pressure or mild stinging. Sensitive areas like lips may be more tender, but most find it very tolerable.

faq.question: How long do dermal fillers last?
faq.answer: Duration varies by product and area: lips (6-9 months), nasolabial folds (9-12 months), cheeks (12-18 months), jawline/chin (12-18 months). Factors affecting longevity include metabolism, lifestyle, area treated, and product chosen. Regular top-ups help maintain results.

Not when performed by skilled injectors. Our philosophy focuses on subtle, natural enhancement that respects your facial proportions. We use conservative amounts and build gradually. You'll look like a refreshed, more youthful version of yourself—not like a different person.
faq.question: Will I look overdone or fake?
What's the difference between brands (Juvederm, Restylane, etc.)?
faq.answer: All premium brands use hyaluronic acid but differ in formulation, texture, and durability. Juvederm has a smooth, cohesive gel ideal for lips and fine lines. Restylane has a granular structure providing more lift—excellent for cheeks and contouring. We'll select the best product for your specific needs.

Yes! One key advantage of hyaluronic acid fillers is they're completely reversible. An enzyme called hyaluronidase can dissolve the filler within 24-48 hours if you're unhappy with results. This provides important peace of mind, though dissolution is rarely needed.
faq.question: Can fillers be reversed if I don't like them?
What should I avoid before treatment?
faq.answer: For 1 week before: avoid blood-thinning supplements (fish oil, vitamin E, ginger, ginkgo), alcohol, and aspirin/ibuprofen unless medically necessary. These increase bruising risk. Continue prescription medications. Arrive with clean, makeup-free skin if possible.

Immediate results with mild swelling and possible bruising for 3-7 days. Swelling peaks at 24-48 hours, particularly with lips. You can apply makeup after 24 hours. Results improve as swelling subsides over 2 weeks. Most people resume normal activities immediately.
faq.question: What can I expect after treatment?
Are there any risks or side effects?
faq.answer: Common side effects are temporary: swelling, bruising, redness, and tenderness for a few days. Rare complications include lumps (usually massage-able), infection, or vascular occlusion (blocked blood vessel—extremely rare with experienced injectors). We take extensive precautions to minimize risks.

faq.question: How much filler will I need?
faq.answer: This varies significantly based on your goals and anatomy. Lips typically require 0.5-1ml, cheeks 2-4ml per side, nasolabial folds 1-2ml total. We often recommend starting conservatively and building over multiple sessions for natural results. Exact amounts determined during consultation.

faq.question: Can I combine fillers with other treatments?
faq.answer: Absolutely! Fillers pair beautifully with anti-wrinkle injections (addressing both volume loss and expression lines), skin boosters, and PRP treatments. Many patients achieve optimal results through combination approaches. We'll create a comprehensive treatment plan.

You'll see immediate improvement, but final results appear after 2 weeks once swelling resolves and product settles. Some products (like Voluma) continue improving for 4 weeks as they integrate and attract water. Be patient—the wait is worth it!
faq.question: When will I see final results?

faq.answer: Pricing depends on product type and volume needed. Single area treatments start from £295 (0.5-1ml). Full face rejuvenation using multiple syringes ranges from £800-1,500. We'll provide an exact quote during consultation. Payment plans available.
faq.question: How much do dermal fillers cost?
